node.text: Until just recently, Vancouver Island’s landmass was almost entirely old-growth rainforest, yet only about 10% remains today thanks to industrial logging. These old trees play a critical role in boosting a forest’s immunity – when we lose them, we lose the blueprint of an entire ecosystem’s resilience. We cannot level what took hundreds, even thousands, of years for nature to perfect and expect it ever to recover, so we need your help. Governments and large corporations feel secure making harmful environmental decisions when allowed to operate in the shadows, often taking special measures to prevent the public from becoming aware of their actions. Well, we can see them now, and we are not about to let them get away with it. Please visit the link in my bio and urge BC officials to protect the last of our old-growth forests before it is too late. Video by @ReelWater. With @FairyCreekBlockade. #FairyCreekBlockade #FairyCreek #VancouverIsland #BC #BritishColumbia #Canada #Logging #Trees #Forests #AncientForests #OldGrowth #SaveOldGrowth #SaveOldGrowthNow #SaveFairyCreek #Conservation

node.text: 🔊 Please turn up your volume to learn about Timor-Leste's incredible marine ecosystems and get a behind-the-scenes look at our encounter with a magnificent blue whale. Looking into the eye of the largest animal that has ever lived on our planet and seeing them stare back was an experience that changed me forever. I have been fortunate enough to visit many unique locations, and I have seen some wonderful things in my career, but there are only a handful of memories I'll think about on my deathbed. This is one of them. The cobalt waters of Timor-Leste are abundant with an incredible variety of life, making responsible, sustainable ecotourism an ideal way for local communities to support themselves. Our objective at @sealegacy and @onlyone is to share the beauty and wonder of these faraway places so people everywhere will be inspired to stand up and protect them from the threat of climate change and other human-made issues. Please consider visiting the link in my bio and supporting our conservation mission by joining The Tide today. On expedition for @sealegacy in Timor-Leste with @mitty, @andy_mann, and @sonyalpha. #ShotOnSony #SonyAlpha #BeAlpha #whale #bluewhale #timorleste #life #beauty #conservation #bucketlist

node.text: There’s only one thing in wildlife and nature photography that really matters, and that’s the moment. Every situation that unfolds in front of me is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to tell a story that can connect a global audience to the most important issues facing our planet. There is always more than just my creative vision to consider, especially underwater – am I weighted properly, is everything working, where are the other divers, where are the other sharks. But if I can shoot 8K video and 50 MP stills with the same tool, I have one less thing to worry about and am free to go off and be an artist. Conservation and storytelling are my passions – it is a pleasure to have partners that make it easier to succeed. Shot on the new @sonyalpha α1 while on assignment for @sealegacy with @mitty, @andy_mann, and @samkretch. #shark #tigershark #bahamas #sealegacy1 #sony #sonyalpha #a1 #bealpha

node.text: 🔊 // Congratulations to @sonyalpha on the launch of their new α1 camera – please turn up your volume and enjoy this beautiful video about an epic milestone in photography. Cristina and I recently became some of the first people in the world to shoot with their new technology underwater, and it is already changing the way we see and think as photographers. I am especially excited because innovation like this results in an enhanced ability to do our conservation work better than ever before. As always, I am incredibly grateful to have a sponsor and partner that provides us with the best tools in the world to tell the planet's most important stories. #sony #sonyalpha #a1 #bealpha

node.text: The Galápagos is an invaluable and irreplaceable treasure of our ocean – a truly legendary World Heritage Site that is a refuge for 3,000 marine species. Yet, industrial and unsustainable fishing practices continue to plunder its waters and devastate its fragile ecosystem thanks to inaction from a government that has pledged to protect it. Please visit the link in my bio where you can show your support for additional protections by signing our petition – we need your help to ensure Ecuadorian President @leninmorenog and President of the National Assembly @cesarlitardo fulfill their commitment to expanding the Galápagos Marine Reserve before any further damage is done. With @onlyone and @sealegacy. @mas_galapagos2020 #masgalapagos #yoestoycongalapagos #galapagos #ecuador #gratitude

node.text: Today is @mitty's birthday. I am so fortunate and thankful to have a partner in life who not only matches my passion but magnifies it. Cristina is a caring mother, talented diver, fearless explorer, gifted photographer, and tireless conservationist. She is wise and kind, and leads with a gentle heart. She makes everyone around her better, myself included. Please consider celebrating her birthday with me by visiting the link in my bio and joining The Tide to support our conservation mission at @sealegacy and our activation platform, @onlyone – 100% of your contribution will go directly to projects and campaigns to rebuild marine life. As always, thank you for standing with us to protect the world's oceans – your support means the world to all of us. Feel free to leave a birthday message for her below, and I'll be sure she sees them. #onlyoneocean #birthday #partner #inspiration #luckyguy

node.text: The fjords of northern Norway are unlike any place on Earth. I have visited several times during my career and captured many of my proudest images there. Now, talk of seismic oil and gas exploration threatens to put Lofoten's enormous orca population at risk. I am excited to announce the upcoming @onlyone screening of our new short documentary film, 'Echoes in the Arctic,' on Tuesday, November 10th, at 7 pm ET (4 pm PT). Filmmakers @mitty, @andymaser, @tahriasheather, and I will be sticking around afterward for a live Q&A, so be sure to RSVP at the link in my bio – hope to see you there. #onlyoneocean #orca #lofoten #norway #documentary #filmmaking #climatechange #conservation #storytelling

node.text: 🔊 // Art and storytelling have sparked many beautiful relationships in my career, but few are as meaningful as this one. I have spent countless evenings sifting through my image library with @thelumineers blasting in the background, so to discover that @jeremiahfraites, co-founder of my favourite band, had one of my fine art pieces hanging on his wall was a wonderful surprise. Soon after connecting, I discovered we had much more in common than a healthy appreciation for each other's art. Jeremiah and his wife, @francesca_laz, are avid conservationists who care deeply about the same bears in Katmai, Alaska, that I have been obsessed with ever since photographing them in 1991, long before my @natgeo days. He recently sent me a demo of "Maggie" after divulging his upcoming solo project, and I instantly recognized it as an opportunity to collaborate. Today, I am proud to share the music video we crafted together. Most of this footage has never been seen outside the @sealegacy walls – it is a tribute to the intelligent, majestic, and vulnerable brown bears of Alaska. Together, we hope our art will inspire you to join us in a stand against the Pebble Mine development that threatens to wipe out their habitat. The time for action is now – visit the link in my bio to send a message to Senator Sullivan, Senator Murkowski, and the EPA today. Filmed on assignment for @sealegacy with @andymaser, @samkretch, and @kyle.roepke. #jeremiahfraites #thelumineers #maggie #pianopiano #newmusic #bear #brownbear #katmai #bristolbay #alaska #pebblemine #stoppebblemine #vetopebblemine #nopebblemine #shareyourbears #thinkaboutbears #art #collaboration #conservation #passion

node.text: 🔊 Please turn up your volume and come on a journey with me to witness the remarkable coastal wolves of British Columbia. // I am really proud of our small but mighty @sealegacy team when I see them create powerful and impactful storytelling pieces. Please watch the entire film and let me know your thoughts. @sealegacy and our partners at @raincoastconservation have a plan to end the commercial trophy hunting of wolves, bears, and wolverines in British Columbia’s Kitlope Conservancy permanently, but we need your help. Two very generous patrons have just confirmed they will donation-match half of the final $100,000 needed to buy up the remaining hunting licenses in the area, which would double the impact of your contribution. A good friend of mine and avid supporter of @sealegacy just came in for $20K. Please visit the link in my bio if you want to get involved in pushing this protection over the finish line so we can save this community of wolves. 🙏💙 Shot on assignment for @sealegacy with @johnkelseyphoto. Audio and BTS clips by @maxwelhohn, @steve_woods_photography, and @seaforthexpeditions. Edited by @chadrichmond. #wolf #coastalwolf #bear #wolverine #kitlopeconservancy #BC #canada #fundraiser #conservation #donation #gratitude

node.title: Help Us Save BC’s Coastal Wolves

Thank you team @sealegacy! #nopebblemine  #gratitude

node.text: 🔊 Sound on to hear @mitty tell the beautiful story of the Mermaids of Atauro – I couldn't resist lifting it from her account to share with all of you. I am always in awe of how easily she connects with people on expedition. Her energy is infectious, kind, and gentle – people invite her into their worlds the same way animals let me into theirs. It helps that she speaks several languages, Portuguese in this case. Next month, we board our boat and set off on assignment with the @sealegacy team to unearth more moments like this. In the meantime, click my bio link to sign up for @onlyone and watch more from "The Last Coral Kingdom" series on our 30x30 journey. // Reposted from @mitty: "'Obrigada pela natureza.' The song drifted across the sea from a woman moving waist-deep in the shallows of Timor-Leste, her voice rising gently with the rolling swells. I knew instantly who she was and waded out to her from shore, tears welling in my eyes as I recognized the meaning behind the Portuguese words. Spanning around her in a wide circle were a handful of tiny boats trailing baited hooks through the water, an ingenious fishing technique I had never seen before used by the Wawata Tapu; the Mermaids of Auturo. As I drew close, she smiled brightly and sang again, "Obrigada pela natureza, hallelujah!" A fisherwoman's hymn giving thanks to nature for providing for her family. A surge of hope flooded through me, and in that moment, I wanted the world to meet Sara. Today, you finally can." // With @samkretch, @andy_mann, and @mitty on assignment for @sealegacy. #onlyoneocean #30x30 #thelastcoralkingdom #mermaidsofauturo #timorleste

node.text: Always remember – every time you see a post on my account, millions of other people are seeing it with you. We don't have to worry in solitude or face climate change alone, because we have each other. @onlyone's Green Seas Journey features remarkable people around the world who are harnessing innovation and community to unlock the ocean's healing power and restore our broken planet. Visit the link in my bio to learn more about them and find out how you can help. #onlyoneocean #ocean #healingpower #community #greenseas #inthistogether

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Paul Nicklen on July 20, 2021. May be an image of nature.

node.text: I generally try to escape into the wild and enjoy a day or two far from phones and laptops on my birthday, but this year, I'm hoping to do something special with all of you to advocate for conservation instead. Please join @Mitty and me tomorrow, July 21st, at 12:15 pm PT (3:15 pm ET) for "The Modern Eco-Warriors" – an online event co-hosted by our friends, Bill Kurtis and Donna LaPietra. We'll be discussing intersectional environmentalism, the synergy of art and conservation, greenwashing, and more, all while raising some much-needed funds for @SeaLegacy. Visit the link in my bio to get your free ticket – I can't wait to see you there. With @MarinMagazine, @BetterChicago, @WaitWaitNPR, and @KurtisProductions. #Bear #BrownBear #Grizzly #GrizzlyBear #Alaska #UnitedStates #Mother #MotherBear #Cubs #Family #Event #ModernEcoWarriors #Tickets #SignUp #JoinUs⁠⁠

node.text: The ocean has been a mystery for much of human history (and still is to a large extent), but life here is often more familiar than not. Our conservation mission is built on the principle that it becomes easier to speak up on behalf of vulnerable wildlife when we see a little of ourselves in them, and few stories have the power to connect us like those of a mother's love. #Whale #Beluga #Humpback #HumpbackWhale #SeaLion #StellerSeaLion #Mother #Offspring #Babies #Conservation #Storytelling #MothersLove

node.text: ⁠#LimitedEditionPrint // As a biologist, I am fascinated by the changing seasons and their effect on wildlife populations at our planet's extremes, where conditions shift dramatically. As temperatures steadily drop to -22 ℉ (-30 ℃) on the Fishing Branch River in Canada's Yukon, young bears like this ice-covered female must forage non-stop for fish, carrion, and other sources of nutrition until it is time to sleep for the winter. Dwindling resources force these typically isolated nomads into close proximity, so she must be on the lookout for big, lumbering males or protective mothers with their cubs at every moment. I hope images like 'Cold Pursuit' underscore the struggle of life in the wild and convince us to rethink the actions that are jeopardizing their survival. // To inquire about this piece or view my entire fine art catalog, please visit the link in my bio. #FineArt #LimitedEdition #Bear #Grizzly #GrizzlyBear #BrownBear #Yukon #Canada #Challenges #Survival #Conservation

node.text: #LimitedEditionPrint // Large male polar bears can weigh up to a thousand pounds or more. As they trek through the Arctic looking for seals, the snow beneath their paws becomes hard and compacted. Winter winds eventually excavate the surrounding fluffy snow to expose beautiful, elevated tracks like those in 'Polar Impressions.' I capture most of my photographs during the moment, but there is always a sense of mystery when I arrive on the scene a little late. Where was this polar bear going? Why? Sometimes storytelling means providing an ending so that you can write the beginning yourself. // To inquire about this piece or view my entire fine art catalog, please visit the link in my bio. #FineArt #LimitedEdition #Bear #PolarBear #Svalbard #Norway #Arctic #Tracks #Storytelling #BeginWithTheEnding

node.text: #LimitedEditionPrint // I captured 'Lost in Tradition' while waiting out a blizzard in Qaanaaq, Greenland, with this Inuit hunter. It wasn't until hours later that we were able to resume travel across the sea ice with his huskies. Photography has exposed me to many extreme conditions and remarkable people around the world, yet I had never witnessed such mastery of the unforgiving Arctic. It is an honor to share his portrait with you. // To inquire about this piece or view my entire fine art catalog, please visit the link in my bio. #FineArt #LimitedEdition #Inuit #Hunter #Qaanaaq #Greenland #Arctic #Unforgiving #Portrait #MasterOfTheNorth

node.text: A small herd of muskox huddle together as they slowly traverse the gentle white slopes of Ellesmere Island in Nunavut, the very heart of Canada's Arctic. They are no stranger to the bitter cold, having migrated across Beringia (the land bridge that once stretched from Siberia to North America) between 200,000 and 90,000 years ago before eventually reaching Greenland. At one point, they ranged as far south as the city of Toronto, which is fun to imagine. The Inuit call them Umingmaq, which means 'the bearded one,' and make traditional use of their meat for food, hides for insulating sleeping mats, and horns and bones for tools and carvings. #Muskox #Umingmaq #EllesmereIsland #Nunavut #Canada #Arctic #Inuit #Beringia #LandBridge #Siberia #NorthAmerica #Nomads

node.text: Today is both Shark Awareness and World Orca Day, but because sharks get the entire week, I decided to feature my favorite marine apex predator instead. In a way, I owe my entire career to this iconic species – seeing them interact with the Jacques Cousteau team on his program during one unremarkable afternoon at the University of Victoria was the moment my vision for a future in conservation crystallized. Decades later, I had the opportunity to photograph them for myself below Norway's icy waves. The fight to protect British Columbia's orca continues in my backyard – the Canadian federal government is doubling down on a pipeline that would increase tanker traffic sevenfold while commercial fishing and fish farms slowly wipe out the salmon that are their primary food source. To learn more about the conservation measures taking place and find out how you can help, please visit the @WildOrcaOrg website through the link in my bio. #Orca #WorldOrcaDay #Andfjorden #Norway #Winter #JacquesCousteau #UniversityOfVictoria #UVic #Conservation #Mission #Beauty

node.text: I am rarely happier than when surrounded by sharks – I find their beauty, intelligence, and ability to survive inspiring. When I look into their eyes, I know without a doubt that giving them a voice is my purpose in this life. Sharks are apex predators and often a keystone species of an ocean ecosystem – without their regulation, nature's delicate balance decays, and vast, complex networks of life quickly devolve into chaos. Costa Rica is home to dozens of shark species, many of which are threatened by overfishing. Earlier this year, President @CarlosAlvQ gutted vital protections that have hindered the Ministry of Environment's ability to safeguard them, left several endangered species vulnerable to extinction. Without action today, iconic sharks like the hammerhead could become extinct within the next twenty years. This #SharkWeek, please visit the link in my bio and sign our @OnlyOne petition demanding an end to the slaughter of endangered sharks in Costa Rica. With @MigraMarNet, @CremaCostaRica, and @Randall_Arauz. Photo by @Mitty. Shot on @SonyAlpha while on assignment for @SeaLegacy in The Bahamas. #SonyAlpha #SonyArtisan #BeAlpha #Shark #TigerShark #Bahamas #TheBahamas #CostaRica #Conservation #Overfishing #Endangered #Extinct #Hammerhead #HammerheadShark #StopKillingSharks #Petition

node.text: I have captured well over two million photographs during my career, and every so often, I discover something that has never seen the light of day while browsing through my archives for new fine art. I thought I would share one such image with you today – a never-before-seen moment from my favorite leopard seal encounter. Looking at it now brings memories of that day flooding back, and I wonder how our changing climate has affected this beautiful animal who worked so hard to make sure the stranger in her ocean had enough penguins to eat. I hope she is well. #Seal #LeopardSeal #Penguin #ChinstrapPenguin #Antarctica #FineArt #Archives #NeverBeforeSeen #EncounterOfALifetime #ClimateChange #Conservation

node.text: ⁠#LimitedEditionPrint // There is a lot to consider when freediving to eye level with a mother humpback and her calf. On the day I captured 'Megaptera,' the most important question running through my mind was how to position myself with as little movement as possible so they would not be disturbed. I observed from the surface for over an hour before finally daring to make my attempt, descending forty feet on a single breath before inching towards them, carefully monitoring her reaction as I advanced. Humpbacks have exceptional buoyancy control and use their pectoral flukes to counter any movement in the water. When she lifted her pec on my approach, I wondered: was she compensating for the current, or was I getting too close? No picture is worth agitating an animal, so I decided to err on the side of caution. Rather than rush to the surface and relieve the burning sensation in my lungs, I gently created some distance before allowing myself to drift upwards without a single kick. I am proud of the relationship I maintain with wildlife – at the end of the day, it is the most important part of my job. // To inquire about this piece or view my entire fine art catalog, please visit the link in my bio. Shot on @SonyAlpha under Special Interaction Permit (Regulation 13) from the Ministry of Tonga. #SonyAlpha #SonyArtisan #BeAlpha #FineArt #LimitedEdition #Whale #Humpback #HumpbackWhale #Tonga #Diving #Underwater #Mother #Calf #Baby #Wildlife #Relationship #Respect #Gratitude

node.text: On this journey through life and time, I have had the good fortune to meet a lot of inspirational people. Well, this week, I had the pleasure of meeting and working alongside one of the all time greats in the world of cinematography.  Emmanuel Lubezki aka “Chivo" @chivexp has been the Director of Cinematography and the behind the camera on many of the classics such as The Revenant, Y Tu Mama Tambien, Like Water For Chocolate, The Birdcage, Birdman, Gravity and this list is just getting started.  I was like a kid and hammered this poor man with thousands of questions, savoring every one of his answers. He is kind, patient and has an incredible eye.  The best part is that he is photographing @mitty as part of a large passion project about thought leaders and change makers. I was here to simply help out with a couple of the underwater situations but I remain the humble student.  And, best of all, tomorrow we are back home with our dogs for the first time in 9 and a half months.  #love #passion #friendship #inspired

node.text: #LimitedEditionPrint // Extreme recession of glacial ice in the northern hemisphere due to climate change is a complicated issue, and there are many trickle-down impacts we are only just beginning to understand. For example, as glaciers shrink from the ocean and become land-locked, they no longer contribute bergs to the marine ecosystem. Seals then have nowhere to rest, and polar bears like this big, fat male, seen climbing out of the Barents Sea onto a chunk of glacial ice, lose the hunting grounds that are vital to their survival. I believe art inspired by science can motivate conservation, and 'On Ancient Ice' particularly reminds me of the lives at stake should we fail to act. // To inquire about this piece or view my entire fine art catalog, please visit the link in my bio. #FineArt #LimitedEdition #Bear #PolarBear #Svalbard #Norway #Glaciers #ClimateChange #Art #Science #Conservation #SoMuchAtStake
